Class AbstractBook

java.lang.Object
book.AbstractBook
Direct Known Subclasses:
Book
public abstract class AbstractBook extends Object
Abstract base class representing a generic Book.

This class provides common properties and methods for all book types and defines an abstract method displayDetails() to be implemented by subclasses.

Example Usage: 

 public class Book extends AbstractBook {
     public Book(String title, String author, String genre, int pageNumbers, String language, double value) {
         super(title, author, genre, pageNumbers, language, value);
     }

  • Constructor Details

    • AbstractBook

      protected AbstractBook(String title, String author, String genre, int pageNumbers, String language, double value)
      Constructs an AbstractBook with the specified properties.
      Parameters:
      title - the title of the book
      author - the author of the book
      genre - the genre of the book
      pageNumbers - the number of pages in the book; must be greater than 0
      language - the language of the book
      value - the monetary value of the book; must be non-negative
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if pageNumbers <= 0 or value < 0

    • displayDetails

      public abstract void displayDetails()
      Displays the details of the book.

      Implementing classes should override this method to provide a concrete implementation that outputs book details in a specific format.
